chargeHist.descr: 1ST Degree Child Sexual Assault-Sexual Contact With A Child Under Age 13
1ST Degree Child Sexual Assault-Sexual Contact With A Child Under Age 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Alan Maynard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violation of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
Absolutely no contact with L.L.R., C.F. or family.  No contact in person, 3rd party contact, social media, telephone, email or texting.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot be involved with any occupation and/or volunteer positions with children under the age of 16.

Cooperate with agent as to home and office visits.
Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
Attend mental health evaluation and comply with any treatment and/or prescribed medication.
Attend sex offender evaluation.
-Court ordered defendant to 15 years sexual offender registry.
Defendant ordered to pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Correction.
Attend AODA assessment and comply with treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalzyers.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
The court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim witness surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor/explosives and/or magazines.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert Alan Maynard appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Robert Alan Maynard.  Prosecuting attorney Alicia H Kort in court for the State of Wisconsin. State has complied with victims' rights law.    The Court finds the defendant has requested to appear via zoom for sentencing.  
Statements made by victim: Charlie (read by mother, Cassandra F)  Additional statements by Cassandra F.  Statements from State, Defense and defendant. 
Sentencing proceeded.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of  5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No violation of the law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with Agent as to home and office visits.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- Attend Mental Health evaluation and comply with any treatment and/or prescribed medication.
- Attend Sex Offender evaluation
- Attend AODA Assessment and comply with treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, Random Urine Screens and Breathalyzers.
- Absolutely NO CONTACT with L.L.R., C.F. or family.  No contact in person, 3rd party contact, social media, telephone, email or texting.  
- Court ordered defendant to 15 years sexual offender registry.
- Court ordered that the defendant cannot be involved with any occupation and/or volunteer positions with children under the age of 16 years.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge)  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
- Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
- Defendant ordered to pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Correction.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor/explosives and/or magazines.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.   mn

FILED:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial
Defendant's Report for Consideration at Sentencing, Filed.
OFF THE RECORD:  At the request of Counsels and with the Courts permission, the sentencing hearing is adjourned to 9/15/22 at 2:00 in Br 45.  mn

Defendant Robert Alan Maynard in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Robert Alan Maynard in custody Jackson Correctional.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Alan Maynard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Original Amended Information received and e-filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Court advised defendant if they are not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, they could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting.  Defense will file memorandum.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Robert Alan Maynard not in court, in custody, Jackson Correctional; appearance waived.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense awaiting discovery from another jurisdiction.  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 1:30pm via Zoom.  kmw

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Robert Alan Maynard not in court, in custody.  Susan Frederickson on behalf of Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense needs more time to review case. Case remains calendered in Br. 34.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 09:00 am in room 502SB.

Defendant Robert Alan Maynard in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Robert Alan Maynard in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Alan Maynard appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Village of Brown Deer Police Officer Brett Olig.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cassandra L.F., LLR (DOB 02/18/2008), VRF (DOB 05/01/2013)

Defendant Robert Alan Maynard in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Robert Alan Maynard in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Alan Maynard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
